text: Taster at brewery. Pours yellow and cloudy with a thin white head. Leaves trace lacing in the glass. A fair amount of pine on the nose. Fragrant and floral on the tongue. Finished clean. Solid example of style.
Pours beautiful hazy burnt yellow. Nose is ripe peach. sweet. taste is sweet peaches, mango, nectarine, grapefruit, tropical fruit, light caramel. Yummy!

Tasted from can. Pours a murky gold with thick white head. Aroma is passionfruit, mango, pineapple, melon. Taste is moderately bitter. Flavors of tropical fruits similar to aroma with some resin, caramel and toffee. Excellent IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can shared by a friend. Pours opaque orange with a thick white head. Nose of malt, orange, grapefruit and tart tropical fruit. Malt and orange flavor with grapefruit accents before a bitter piney finish.

Can 1pt. [ As Trillium Fort Point Pale Ale - Galaxy Dry Hopped ].Hazy matt medium orange color with a large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, sweet malt, light caramel, heavy hoppy, pine, citrus, mango, grapefruit. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and light heavy bitter with a long duration, sweet malt, pale malt, citrus, grapefruit, mango, hoppy, dry. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20161128]
 8-3-8-4-17

Can shared at Cotteridge Wines cheers to Jaz and Andrew Harries; cloudy yellow pour with a bubbly off white head, aroma has skunky pine and spice, taste has tangerine, big resinous pine, very tropical.

Poured from can dated 1/5/17 murky gold with a fluffy off white head. Juicy aroma of dank citrus pungent floral notes and faint biscuit. Taste is luscious grapefruit grass grain floral hops and balanced bitterness. Well crafted as usual.
From a 16 oz. can. Pours a murky gold with an off white head. Fruity nose. Flavors of citrus, a bit of mint, and pine. Luscious.

Can. Pours hazy, barely translucent apricot with a thin eggshell head. Aroma features fresh malt and pear tones. Flavor ups the fruit and malt, especially the fruit, rather tart. Mouthfeel presents OK body and good fizz. Hold down this fort.
Can at home, acquired in a trade. Fairly malty for a Trillium beer, some bread and bitterness. Nice but not much more than that.

Thank you Mathieu87 + PriorL for the effort! Can sampled @ Samson en Geert Bierproef Avond. Fresh - few weeks old. Very milky citrus golden, little white head. Nose is massive white grape hop, citrus hop, fruit is explosive, massive white grape. Taste s lightly milky yeasty, not as as thick & milkshake heavy as some other in its style luckily, massive white grape, white berries, citrus low onion. Very fruity very nice. Body is quite thick, not too milkshake like. Very solid & pleasant APA / IPA. Another very solid Trillium beer.

I poured this one from a can. It was a hazy golden color with a white fluffy head. The aroma was bursting with citrus. Truly amazing. Super floral and citrusy, and not overly bitter. Just right. I wish I had more!
Big juicy tropical and pineapple citrusy nose and flavor. Didnt have the depth of the DDH version, but pretty damn good as well. Drinks like an IPA, but without the bitterness.

Aroma - is bursting at the seams with all manner of juicy hops that are tropical to include a buffet of: lemon, mango, pineapple, starfruit, and tangerine. The vegetal element enters realms of: cilantro, scallion, bay leaf, and celery. There is also some pine present, and some caramel deep below.
Appearance - the body has a pale sunglow, with a 2" off-white head that hangs out.
Taste - has an amazing mix of juicified hops, that are tropical (pineapple, mango, starfruit, lemon, grapefruit, and even guava). There is also some minor pine, floral, pungency, and herbal hop qualities. There is a vegetal element that is slightly celery seed, even could be described as scallion. Impressive mix. All the while, underneath this is a caramel backbone.
Palate - medium body, velvety texture, the carbonation is average, the finish is dry and carries a nasal exhalation of vegetal notes.

can recieved in a trade, poured a deep hazy golden to orange colour with a white head. lots of tropical fruits, citrus, light malts, mango, and light onion hop notice. taste is bitter floral hops, mango, light malts, citrus, full bodied.

October 2016 - Bottle share at One Canada Square. Many thanks to LKS! As Trillium Fort Point Pale Ale - Galaxy Dry Hopped, 6.6%. Vibrant orange, hazy, foamy off-white head, light lacing. Aroma is mango and pineapple, papaya, light caramelised onion. Body is light, tingly carbonation, smooth. Taste is sweet and sugary, mango, floral, pineapple. Maybe doesnt dry out quite enough for me but its a very nice beer. (4.0)

Peach and pineapple on the nose. Explosive tropical fruit (papaya) up front gives way to a mildly bready middle. Slight hop bitterness in the finish. Wonderful beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Got in a BIF from oline73. 16 ounce can into signature tulip glass, canned on 9/23/2016. Pours very hazy/cloudy golden orange color with a 1-2 finger dense and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of huge tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, mango, melon, passion fruit, papaya, lemon/orange peel, citrus rind, light pepper, pine, honey, wheat, cracker, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic complexity and balance of bright/juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of huge tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, mango, melon, passion fruit, papaya, lemon/orange peel, citrus rind, light pepper, pine, honey, wheat, cracker, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Moderate pine/citrus rind/spicy bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of tangerine, grapefruit, pineapple, peach, mango, melon, passion fruit, papaya, lemon/orange rind, pepper, pine, wheat, cracker, bread, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of bright/juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt flavors; with a nice malt/bitterness balance, and minimal lingering hop astringency after the finish. Moderate dryness from bitterness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp/sticky/resinous, and fairly creamy/grainy mouthfeel that is nice. Minimal warming alcohol for 6.6%. Overall this is an incredible pale ale! All around fantastic complexity, robustness, and balance of bright/juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and easy to drink. This is more bitter, resinous, and drying than their IPAs; but still very bright/juicy on hops and highly enjoyable.

Bottle shared at the level 42. Canary wharf tasting 20/10/2016. Huge thanks to Leighton for this one. A hazed golden orange coloured pour with a lasting thin white head. Aroma is big juicy dank hop, tangerine, onion, mango. Flavour is composed of juicy mango, freshly cut grass, mango, grassy. Tangerine. Palate is semi sweet. Moderate carbonation, slightly sticky, moderate carbonation. Really easy going.

Can shared in CW. Big thanks to Leighton. It pours a hazed pale golden color with a small white head. Aroma is hugely danky with notes of wood onions weed and lemon peel. Taste is also big time danky and citric with notes and wood and onions. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, tastee

UPDATED: OCT 21, 2016 Can big thanks to LKS. Drank at level 42 tasting. It pours cloudy orange with a thick off - white head. The aroma is fresh, juicy, orange creamsicle, peachy, nectarine, brioche, candy and mango. The taste is smooth and mellow, with not much bitterness, peachy, nectarine, pine needles, grass, danky action and soap with a dry finish. Medium body and soft carbonation. Very tasty stuff. Drinks crazy easy.

16oz can purchased at the Fort Point brewery. Pours dark orange, hazy with a light eggshell foamy head. Smells fruity, hoppy, citrusy with a hint of mango. Tastes hoppy, citrusy great bitter finish, slight malt and floral. Great mouthfeel, full slightly carbonated with a nice lasting after taste. Delicious juice by Trillium
Can shared with the DB guys. Hazy golden pour with a frothy head. Notes of citrus, orange, pineapple,, light pine, light resin, mangoes and a nice smooth bitterness. Awesome stuff!
Can shared by Jackl, thanks buddy! Cloudy golden pour. Nice hoppy citrus aroma. This is good stuff.....not too bitter.
Can shared by Jack - thanks! Hazy golden yellow pour with a white head. Passion fruit, citrus, some resin. Yum.
Can. Pours hazy juicy dark orange with a small white head. Aromas of lemon, grass, citrus, papaya, dank fresh hops, herbs. Taste has papaya, mango, melon, apricots, citrus, orange, dank hops. Damn!

Can at and big kahoona gratis to Bespin/Lando, 04/10/16.
Hazed golden orange with a well appointed egg shell white cap.
Nose is tangerine, straw, earthy hops, apricot, dank strokes, soft bread, light pine.
Taste comprises grapefruit, orange pith, pine needle, dank skunk bite, soft bread, apricot, fresh grass.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, dank hop bitterness at the curtain call.
Xolid hop drop.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Can shared with Cloin. (Dont worry bros - got more.) Pours murky gold with a creamy, white head. Peachy aroma, with some melon, nectarine, orange. The nose has more peach, light piney bitterness, some graoefruit, melon, tangerine. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Finishes with light resin, pale bread, melon, tangerine, orange. Nice depth, good hop expression. Super drinkable.

Can. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of mellow citrus, juicy dank hops, mango, peach, pineapple and just plain hop pallets. The taste is juicy, crisp, mellow and dank with a lot of tropical notes. Crushable and a nice balance between the low bitterness and the crispy hop-bite!

16 oz can to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a juice-like mango with foamy off-white head. Smells good too; a juice bomb with loads of pineapple, orange, and tropical fruit. Tastes like it smells with a juicy medium-bodied mouthfeel that finishes with some zesty bitterness. A great example of the style.
Super cloudy, light orange gold. Bright tropical fruit, citrus. Lightly bitter, some sweetness. Chewy, long finish. Excellent.
Pours a hazy orange with a thick white head. Aroma of mango and grapefruit. Taste follows, bitter and juicy.
Pounder can bought @ Trillium a few hours before. Poured a murky golden color with an averaged sized head. Cirrus, tropical fruits, and just all around nice and hoppy. Dank and some pine too.

Can from Trillium. Very hazy light orange pour with a small head. Nose is very bright and engaging. Plebty of tropical fruits - papaya, mango, pineapple. Assertive dirty green biomass. Bits of white onion. Flavor is moderately bitter. Somewhat dry on the finish. Light biscuit. Fairly chalky, fullish mouthfeel. Almost mineralic. Grass and tropical fruit accents abound. Easy drinking. Overall, great stuff.
Can. Grat fruit salad nose, grass, grapefruit, tropical fruits. Great fruit flavor, peppery hops, light bitterness. Creamy, fruity. Full body Dirty cloudy looking.

Very hazy light yellow. Aroma is pineapple, slight papaya, slight peach, mango. Very fruity aroma. Tropical fruits dominate the palate with slight bitter finish. Very creamy without being sweet. Dry slightly bitter finish. Incredibly balanced. Fantastic
Poured a hazy golden color with a white head. Aroma was of grassy, earthy dank and 0ineapple. Flavor similar, dry, juicy, mild bitterness. Super crushable.
Cloudy golden pour with a white head. Some melon and peach aroma, something was "off" from the standard FP and I think I prefer it but then it really started to grow on me.

Cans from the brewery. Not sure about the color as Im drinking it straight from the can. Peach and grapefruit notes give way to the hoppy bitterness. Sturdy caramel malt backbeats. Good body and mouthfeel.
16oz can. Nice orange haze. Pine, mango, pineapple, passion fruit aroma. Peach flavor and tropical fruit on the palate. Great crushable mouthfeel. Nice malt balanced backbone.
Can thanks to art. Poured hazy yellow with white head. Aroma slight smokey hop. Light carb med bod. Taste smooth balanced light dank resin.

Canette 473ml, gracieuseté de msjpearson, Thanks Mike! Couleur orange trouble pratiquement opaque, mousse blanc cassé onctueuse. Arôme dananas mur, houblon résineux, pointe de cannabis, mangue, malt pâle. Goût juteux à souhait, mangue, ananas, malt délicat, houblon résineux, amertume modérée mais toute en longueur. Carbonatation moyenne, corps dense, duveteux.

Trillium Fort Point Galaxy Pale Ale 6.6% can.

Cloudy gold with an orange tint to it. Big hop bouquet of prickly pear and apricot. Light bodied and dry with big juicy hops, guava, prickly pear and soda bread. Super fruity but perhaps a mite too dry for me.
Bottle. Color hazy orange with medium white head. Aroma pine, mango, passion fruit, lemon, orange. Taste pine, passion fruit, citrus, mango, peach.

Tasted on 8/10/16 from a 16oz can, hanks to Alex. Pours hazy, but bright, orange with a thick, rocky white head that slowly recedes to average, uneven lace. The nose is dank, herbal, and juicy, with everything from peach, mango, pineapple, pine resin, grass, and flowers. The flavor is super juicy, more mango, nectarine, and passion fruit, but also more pine resin, grass and green herbal notes, all with tremendous balance. The body is medium with an oily texture, average carbonation, and a long somewhat bitter orange peel, resin, and herbal finish.
16 ounce can. Pours a hazy gold with a decent white head. Aroma of tropical and pine. Taste is tropical fruits, grapefruit, oranges, and pine. Delicious+
Another home run. This one packs a huge galaxy nose with tropical fruit intermixed with froth.

Comparison post Regular v galaxy

Regular: pours a beautiful cloudy golden with one finger head with moderate lacing. Aromas of lemon, tropical fruit, a little resin. Slightly malt backbone. Hint of sweet up front, then turns moderately bitter. moderate to full body with long slightly bitter finish.

Excellent beer.

Galaxy: pours a beautiful cloudy golden *slightly dark than the original* with one finger head with moderate lacing. Aromas of lemon, tropical fruit, a little resin. *More prominent mango in my opinion.* Slightly malt backbone. Hint of sweet up front which is slightly more in the Galaxy version*, then turns moderately bitter. moderate to full body with long slightly bitter finish.

Also, quite excellent

Bottle thanks to Phil. Pours a super hazy opaque orange, white head. Aroma is pine, citrus, mango, guava, grass, green onion. Flavor is mad mad dank tropical fruits, onion, citrus, bread. Big juicy galaxy BOMB, TRILL at its finest.

Can. Aroma is huge pineapple juice, flowers and mild pine. Tastes awesome. Juicy galaxy hops bring huge tropical fruit with some linger flowers and pine on the back end. Smooth with a mild bitterness. Another great one from trillium.

Tap at the source, Canton. Pours very hazy unfiltered fruit juice, sort of golden grapefruit. Same appearance as normal Fort point. Aroma is pine, more tropical and piney than normal Fort point, guava, tangerine, more dank too. Flavor is dank and piney, tangerine, grapefruit, tropical notes, a bit sweeter than OG. Wow thats good. Not as good of a nose but tastes a bit better than OG. Overall still exceptional.

Oddly solid looking yellow orange color with a fluffy off white head. Great orange citrus happy nose. Bright citrus hop flavor with red grapefruit, apricot and a long orange zest finish. Great hop forward beer.

Bottle, 750ml. A cloudy golden beer with minimal white head. Floral aroma of guava, hops and citrics. Taste is medium bitter with some carbonation and astringency. Medium bodied with a fresh fruity and hoppy aftertaste. Well-balanced and smooth, even with the dry hopped.

Bottle, 750ml. Opaque golden with light sediment and a creamy offwhite head. Pungent tropical and citrus hoppy aromas. Medium bodied, medium to fizzy carbonation. Medium sweet, medium to heavy bitter. Delicious fruity and caramel character into a spicy hoppy finish. Superbly drinkable and very tasty.

Bottle courtesy of skullgeorge. Thanks George! Hazy yellow color with white head. Hoppy and light malty aroma, grassy, floral, citrusy fruity, tropical fruits. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

Shared 25.4 oz. bottle.Golden and cloudy with a white head. Aroma of tropical fruit, grapefruit, citrus, pineapple, resinous. Taste follows nose. Very flavorful. Medium-bodied. Rich for an APA. Excellent.

Sample at Trillium Canton with koleminer20. Aroma is dank, citrus, grass, floral, far different from regular. Appearance is orange juice, hazy orange, white head. Taste is dank, spice, grass, floral, citrus, tropical fruit, weird. Mouthfeel is light body, light crisp carbonation, dank spice and pine aftertaste. Overall, I prefer regular but this is nice.

On draft at Trillium Canton. The pour is a standard bright orange juice from Trillium. Damn. There is a thin right of white head and a couple spots of soapy lace on the way down. The aroma is juicy, bright, and dank (in a good, not Amarillo way). Lots of tropical fruits like pineapple and mango in this one. The flavor is good. There is a strong juiciness to it, but its a bittering pineapple or citrus rind. Not really zest, but the bitter rind. There is a nice hop back one and a sweet juice on the back end. The mouth feel is a little thick, but watery at the same time. The carbonation is excellent. It lasts just enough before a lingering citrus finish carries in forever. Great.

Bottle. Pours murky yellow-orange with a thin soapy white head that lingers. Aroma of pineapple over medium carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy straw colored. Flavor is clean and dry with a very full hop profile and mouthfeel. Floral, dank notes are favored over bitterness to great effect. This is a world-class IPA.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Bomber. Hazy gold with a soapy off white head that lasts and laces. Aromas of grapefruit, mango, pineapple, pine, musty grain, yeast and spice. Flavor is the same, tropical and piney with yeast and grain. Medium bodied, smooth and chewy with a dry end.

Bottle thanks to Steele and Carla, thanks! Pour is cloudy lihht orange juice with a medium white head. Aroma is orange and resinous with a light peppery note. Faint sweet mango as well. Flavor is resinous orange with a light spicy note and some distant sweetness. Really nice.

May 28, 2016. Bottled May 10, 2016, shared by _angst_, thanks!
Cloudy pale orange with a medium sized creamy white head. Aroma is sweet fruity and juicy with pineapple, mango, tangerine, passionfruit, notes of peach
Taste is medium sweet, fruity and soft bitter. Finish is fruity with sweet mango and pineapple notes, soft bitter with grassy and citrusy notes. 
Medium bodied, soft to average carbonation. 
Very good, as always with Trillium.

Aroma: lots of pineapple and citrus, kind of like candied oranges; Appearance: hazy orange pour with thin white head that dissipates fairly quickly; Taste: definitely hoppier than typical APA; full of fresh flavor including grapefruit and mango; Palate: medium bodied with long, bitter finish; Overall: quite delicious. Like my APAs slightly tamer, but really appreciate this.

750ml bottle thanks to darrel. pours out a hazy mess topped with a small head. nose is pine citrus hops a nice malty candy sweetness. Taste is more of the citrus hops sweet candy melons and a great end. This has a nice sweet end.
Big thanks to Jason for the share last week. Cloudy murky golden pour. Big tropical fruit aroma and taste, Pine resin, dank, Mango, Grass, Orange. Medium body.

750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Originally reviewd 4/6/2015.
Hazy orange body. Small white head and a thin collar.

Smells of orange and tropical fruit. A hint of toasty malts and what smells like rye?

Taste has more orange and grapefruit than tropical fruit. Exceptionally hoppy. Almost a bitter orange flavor. Light cracker malt. Low bitterness, but theres not much sweetness, so it stands out.

Medium light body. Well carbonated.

I felt that regular Fort Point smelled better than it tasted, but this seems to be the opposite. Huge citrus hop flavor.

UPDATED: APR 10, 2016 Superbe bouquet à base d?ananas, d?orange amère et de notes herbales.Bouche assez douce, très fruitée, relativement ronde, légèrement sèche en fin et petite longueur légère de notes herbacées. La dominante reste agrume.Du petit lait.
On tap at RateBeer Best 2016. Pour is hazy amber / orange with a medium white head. Notes of grapefruit, orange rind, pine, pineapple, and mango. Finish is well balanced.

Bottle courtesy of rlgk. Pours very hazy yellow with a small creamy white head that leaves lots of spotty trace on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity and grassy with crackers, pink grapefruit juice, passion fruit, star fruit, freshly cut grass, pine needles, lime leaves, minerals and lemon zest. Taste is bitter, heavy fruity and grassy. Mouthfeel is soft, dry, tiny astringent and medium bodied. Finish is bitter with passion fruit, star fruit and peppery grassy hops. Lovely peppery passion fruit hops. Surprisingly I liked this even more than the mosaic version.
A: Cloudy yellow/hint of brown coloured with a white head. N: Hoppy fruity with lots of citrus. T: Pine, citrus as well. O: Very refreshing and nice!

Sample at The Trillium and Tree House-tasting in Kville, Göteborg. Hazy golden/orange color with a nice offwhite head. Fresh hoppy pine aroma, mango, passion fruit, pine apples, lemon juice, orange zest, some grapes. Hoppy pine flavor, passion fruit, citrus, mango, peach, lemon zest notes, some lime. Incredibly fresh hoppy beer.
Pours cloudy golden with a small head. Aroma is tropical fruity citric grainy a bit yeasty. Flavor is as aroma slightly sweet lots of citrus and longlasting aftertaste.
Translucent gold pour, nice white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, spice, dankness. Flavor is pine, dank hops, caramel, fruit. Creamy, nice.
Hazy light orange color, frothy off-white head. Peach, mango, orange, and pineapple. Mild sweetness, light body, and clean. Moderate carb with a lightly bitter finish.

Fresh bottle split at home. This is an amazing (and super hoppy) pale ale. The Galaxy dominates, and I think that your response to this beer would come down to how much you like the hop. Personally, I love Galaxy, and I loved the waves and waves of dank mango and sticky, overripe tropical fruits. Hideously cloudy, but thats what you expect from Trillium. This is as good as an "extreme" pale ale gets.

750ml bottle. Very hazy orange shade. White foam. Huge fruity hoppy notes in the aroma. Tangerine, grapefruit, tropical, cut grass. Taste is dry, juicy, not too bitter, still showing the same fruity notes but more herbal stuff showing through. Just feels a bit flabby and overinflated on the tongue. Very nice though.

Bottle poured into a snifter..hazy gold with a fluffy white head..aroma of citrus fruits..tastes of grapefruit,
mango,passion fruit,florals..medium bodied..good but
not great.

Shard by Matthew. Many thank yous.

Hazy yellowish orange body with a whit cap. Aromas of deliciously fresh hops, tropical fruit. Citrus, pineapple, mango. Amazing. Juicy and ridiculously tasty.

Bottle shared. Hazy glowing orange pour with lacy white head. Aroma is super juicy, jammy, lots of tropical fruits, apricot jam, light dankness, very nice. Taste is lightly bitter, super juicy/jammy, tons of fruity hop flavors. Palate is med-light bodied, creamy, soft carbonation. Classic Trillium, very good.

Bottled, shared by some very kind Ratebeerians. Hazy golden colored, small head. Beautiful strong nose of fresh hops, very fruity. Flavor is a lot less outspoken, hops are more to the background, bready malts take over, together with some yeasty notes. Nice beer, but the exceptionally high score surprises me.

Bottle, 10 days old, small sample. Slight hazy golden color, short head. Aroma of garlic, onion, grassy, lots of pine, some yellow fruit. Medium earthy bitterness. Decent stuff, though nothing to rave about.

750ml bottle (9 days after bottling!) from De Bierkoning @ Beer Temple, shared with Caesar, Benzai & Mr. Hangover. Hazy yellow/golden color. White head, sticky. Aromas: resin, citrus, dank hops. Flavor is rather soft, light bitter, dank. Medium bodied. Long finish with herbal hops, moderate bitter. Good one, but the flavor could have been a bit more outspoken.

Bottle, thnx to Benzai and Potjebier. Pours a hazy golden beer with a bubbly white head on top. Aroma has massive citric notes, slightly herbal notes, incredibly fresh. Flavour is complicated , bitter, fruity and loads of juicy fruits. Nice, firm bitter taste and very nice overall. Great stuff.

Bottle shared. Hazy pale yellow color, medium sized white head that lasts for a decent while. Aroma is lightly malts, nicely hoppy, lightly grassy. Taste malts, very grassy, too fresh, unripe hops basically. Green plants, decently bitter, decent body, average carbonation.

Embouteillée le 20 août et bue de 27 août. Belle mousse blanche sur un corps jaune/doré. Une dentelle se tisse comme une toile daraignée. Le nez est un jus tropical, fait de citron et doranges avec des ananas et du melon. Un profil herbacé se fait oublier derrière ces parfums juteux. Le goût est fantastique avec ses fruits et ses houblons vifs (floraux, forestiers, herbacés) qui sont dans une resplendissante forme. De mémoire, pour moi, cette version est supérieure à la version régulière. Peut-être lextrême fraîcheur y est pour quelque chose. Magnifique présence en bouche. Beau corps svelte et pétillement fin. En finale, une longue amertume fruitée, florale et piquée par des aiguilles de conifères. Un autre coup de cur pour ma fête. Merci à la personne concernée pour cette chance.

Pours a completely unfiltered, vibrant, peach pulp color, with a very stable, froth head.

Exhibits an intense nose of watermelon stones and wet grass, together with orange peel and a whiff of ice-bonbons. The aromas come outstandingly well together, extremely dank, with just the right amount of fruits to create a fantastic, intriguing hop character. Crisp, juicy citrus joins in, as the beer warms up, lending the hops even more profile.

Has a medium carbonation, revealing an awesome hop profile, while letting the beer stay extremely refreshing. For its 6.6 abv it packs a great flavor diversity, leaving the palate very satisfied.

The taste begins, from the very first glance, with grassy lime, silk yeast and bready, balancing malts. Lemons evolve into sweeter, ripe oranges with a distinct grassiness to them, very dough on the palate, packing enough fruits to create an enjoyable hoppy juicyness. Finishes with a great, leafy dankness, bringing up the citrus again, providing a hoppy, bitterness infused dryness, which leaves the palate at the same time as the fruits do.

Fantastic ipa, bursting with a well accentuated hop profile, leading to a focused, intense flavor impression, leaving still space for subtle details.

Bottle. Pours a hazed gold with a large white head. Soft musk on the nose with some light melon and dusty citrus. Medium bodied, soft musk and slowly developing melon and hops. n dusty bitterness on the finish, soft musk and I .

Bottle.
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer, small stable white head.
NOSE: hoppy, fruity, nice.
TASTE: hoppy, fruity, nice.

[ Bottle ][ 8oz ][ @Tasting ][ $ - Trade ] [ Tulip ][ 04.07.15 ]hazy gold, huge white bubbled dense head, lasting forever. Leafy front has too much caramel, light grass, bit of plastic alongside. Way sweet all over, thin body and undercarbonated, caramel oxidation obvious. Too sticky and sweet, overall the low abv should result in less sweetness, more here than acceptable.

UPDATED: JUN 3, 2016 750mL bottled on 5/30/15, drunk 7/9/15Well 6 weeks in the bottom of the fridge has taken us from milk shake to quite cloudy, for whatever thats worth. Head is white, full, very stiff.Dry-tangerine, light, white grapefruit pith and bits of melon in the nose give way to light pale malt honey. Clean, with no garlic/scallion, no astringency and no yeast blandness, nor alcohol. With warming we get more sweet melon leading in to moderate juicy fruits. Good, though the tangerine-grapefruit is a bit pervasive.Very bitter, white grapefruit and unripe-tangerine character brightens the palate up front as honeyed maltiness balances through the middle and unlocks a juicy fruit/watermelon finish with supple, soft dextrines and tight, fine carbonation that make for an endlessly comforting texture. Though it helps balance the prominent bitterness, it may be just a touch too sweet, in the end.Quite similar to the Mosaic dry-hopped version that was released 2 months prior. This one seems a good deal more bitter and perhaps unidimensional (and I think I like mosaic a lot more than Galaxy). Great, though, and very clean with no astringency or blandness whatsoever from either yeast or hops.  At this point, Im just giving these things 5 for appearance.  The head retention is incredible and the particulate never drops no matter what you do (obviously they arent fining it).  7/5/8/4/16Draught at Publick House, 5/25/16A nice looking glass of soup, but with a strong head.  Better than remembered, even, despite my previous rating being a 4.0.  Just phenomenally juicy, with less capsaicin-like character that I associate with Galaxy hops.  In fact, its got no resin, no twang and is just pure melon-mango-lemon bliss.  Hell of a pint, could drink this all night.  Score is for this current batch.
750ml bottle pours a hazy yellow color with a bit of head. Amazing color. Medium hop bitterness. Fruity and bitterness lingers.

Growler at EBF, much thanks to Dave. Pours out a cloudy golden/yellowish color with a small white head. Aroma is of citrus hops, fruity/melon hops, some light grainy toast and mild sweetness. Taste is a solid amount of fruity/tropical hops, light citrus peel, some melon, sweet grainy bread malts with a nice bitterness. Pretty tasty APA.

No head loft, fully hazy straw to peach-yellow beer. Intense dry hop bales nose, lupulin², peachskin, citruspeel. FIne citrus in the mouth, peach, nectarine, lunaria, very fine fruity flavours. Grist/yeastslickness, maybe medium bodied. Excellent beer. Many thanks to M. & L. V.!
Bottle, one day old. Yellow gold, foamy head and heavy lacing. Massive tropical fruits on the nose. Smooth with juicy hops, terrific balance.

750ml bottle into tulip. Minneapolis. 

What a pretty beer. Cloudy orange-amber in color. Nice puffy white head. Lacing. 

Aroma is tropical. Mango, pineapple. Citrus, orange especially. 

Taste is bitter, but not overpowering. Sweetness balance is really well done. 

Body is medium, softer carbonation. Full mouth feel. medium finish.

Poured a murky deep bright orange with a bubbly white head. Aromas of citrus, pine, and dank. Flavor was nicely done with orange, grapefruit, citrus zest, onion, and pine. Medium body and a slick texture. Fizzy carbonation on the tongue and a dry finish. Awesome brew.

Aroma: Nice Garlic, Citrus Rind

Appearance: Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Some Lacing

Taste: Onions, Mild Garlic, Mild Citrus Rind

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Drying

750 shared and thank you tracey. pours a cloudy yellow with white head and nice lacing around the glass. the aroma is mango pineapple, medium malt and hops hops hops, lots of citrus to the point of almost a touch funk. the flavor is totally amazing for such a light abv. medium malts pineapple, mango, straw and grass blended perfectly. hats off to the brewers. you have reached the pinnacle. by the way this bottle is a week old.

750 ml bottle from ndaniels13. Thanks again! It pours a hazy yellow orange color with a huge white head. The aroma is great. Sweet tropical fruit, mostly mango, pineapple and passionfruit with some orange peel and a hint of lime and pine underneath. The flavor is similar. Light citric lime acidity, orange peel, passionfruit with a nice soft pale malt backbone. Juicy and rather citric. Medium bitter finish with just a hint of pine. Great stuff.

750mL bottle, pours a cloudy golden with a small white head. Nose brings out citrus hops, grass and light green onion. Flavour is very fresh, with loads of piney grassy hops upfront, balanced by just enough dry biscuity malt and a little of the green onions creeping in. Quite a unique beer. Super fresh and bright. Could drink litres of this. Excellent.
bottle, pours hazy yellow and orange, aroma is light citrus and green onions, full bodied and a well balanced finish.

Bomber shared thanks to kermis. Pours cloudy golden
 Wow!!! Absolute fruit bomb. So tropical and hoppy. Quite bitter but not too much. Creamy, silky and crisp aswell. Medium bodied. Gorgeous.

Bottle shared. Pours very hazy golden with an off white head. Aroma of tropical fruits, peach, melon, citrus, a little resinous, mango, pineapple. Flavor is light to moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Well balanced in the palate with a nice but not overpowering bitterness and a soft malt sweetness. Light to light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bomber courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Big thanks.
Thick creamy white head. Cloudy blond pour. Tropical fruit aroma. A lovely balanced IPA

Bottle - Pours a cloudy golden yellow. The nose is full of citrus notes like lemons, oranges, and tangerines plus a slight sweetness. The taste is more citrus flavors plus pine, evergreen, and spruce. This stuff is tasty!!!

750ml bottle pours a hazy yellow gold with some creamy, lacing white head. Nose is solid, lots of tropical fruit, guava, some under ripened pineapple, some mango, orange, tangerine, grassy, a little sour cream and chive dip too. Flavor is very smooth, grassy, straw, citrus zest, enough honey notes from the malt to keep it easy, lots of tropical fruit though, a little fruit cocktail. Finishes lightly bitter and oddly a little creamy.

Bottle at Ryans. Pours a bright golden body with white lacing. Aroma is mint lemonade, limes, sour wheat, minerals and cheese. Mouthfeel is perfect with notes of funky hops, sour fruit, cheese and mineral character. Great stuff.

Pour is golden amber with lots of tight white head. Nose is a bit sweet, candied orange, light grain and some malt sweetness. Flavor is overly malty and sweet, stale grains and candied orange. Light body, moderate carb, a touch syrupy.

Bright hazy orange body, medium to large white head, and soapy lacing. Juicy tropical notes with tangerine, papaya, orange marmalade, pine, light resin. Medium bodied, mellow carbonation, nice, clean, drying bitterness in the finish. Awesome.

75cl bottle sample @ lucha libre night comes to LeRoeulx. Thanks Steven.
Orangée, col crémeux blanc.
Arôme offre une agréable profondeur houblonnée oscillant entre agrumes et notes majestueuses daiguilles de pin et de notes tropicales.
Palais est simple, direct et sans compromis, houblonné plein de Galaxy, tropical avec un côté forestier. Malt au caractère pâle et pils restant en balance pour mettre à lhonneur ce houblon.

Bottle thanks going to Eric A. on this bad ass brew. Aroma of garlic, scallions and leafy green hops giving a stinky weed dankness. Flavor is just flat out good! Starts with thick juicy fruit that turns into a mildly danky weed, onion and grassy hints. The texture turns dry that has a very refreshing, crisp finish. Limber Galaxy hops that has a very low bitterness level. Damn, this is awesome....

Bomber, 2 days old. 
Very hazy bright orange with a 1 finger big bubbly head. The aroma is insane. Insanely juicy galaxy hops, tangerine, citrus, grapefruit and a little sweet bread dough. Taste is great. Mouthfeel is good but not a juicy or bright as I was expecting. Its herbal, juicy, grapefruit and tangerine. Really interesting beer and absolutely delicious.
Bottle share thanks to beechner224. light citrus and earthy hop character in aroma. Bottom of bottle murky muddy yellow pour. Citrus and earthy hops, lightly sweet. Very nice.
Bottle in trade. Galaxy hops are nice, citrus and a tad piney. Taste is light piney with citrus. Tasty pale ale. Maybe ipa. Lots of lingering hop bitterness. Awesome beer.

Bottle thanks to t$. A ton of citrus in the nose with a moderate pine. Hazy Orange color with small white head. Taste is like orange marmalade. A truly awesome hop explosion that remains smooth and not overly bitter. Really damn good.

32oz growler during EBF. Poured a hazy yellow/gold with a tight foamy white head. Aroma is lemon, dry grains, citric acid, honey topped dough. Flavor is dry, grainy, tangerine, nectarine, lemon citrus, lime, medium toast. Medium body, softer carbonation, average duration on the aftertaste.

Bottle. The pour is a hazy vibrant yellow. The aroma is amazing, pure hoppiness. The taste is just as good as the aroma. Crisp, piney, fruity hop taste, very floral. Awesome beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle thanks to Reynolds314. Pours cloudy amber, medium creamy off-white head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is dank and topical, some green onion and pot notes. Flavor follows, light sweet, light bitter, hella juicy, dank, weedy, tropical, not harsh at all. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Winner!

Poured from bottle into a tulip: Pours golden orange with a nice tan head. Aroma is a complete tropical fruit bomb, pineapple, mango, orange peel, guava. Taste is more of the same with some light pale malt and a little bitterness from the hops. Medium body, perfect carbonation, this one is great.
bottle, trillium may be a one trick pony but thankfully the trick is awesome. Another home run juicy bomb. They have taken some flavors form the galaxy hop ive never tasted. This is awesome.

Thanks, mikeyv35. This beer is simply wonderful. I loved Fort Point, and this version kicks things up a notch. The beer is cloudy and orange-ish yellow. The head is big and white. Tons of lacing and excellent retention. The aroma is full of delicious fruit. Big peach, pineapple, tangerine, grape, mango, guava, lime. Light pale malt character. The taste is chock full of hop flavor. Dry, yeasty finish. Moderate to medium bitterness in the finish. Big, fresh tropical fruit hop character. Gentle full mouthfeel. Its fresh and soft and full of flavor. Absolutely wonderful stuff.

Bottle from thegerm. Thanks buddy! Dated 2/12/15 and poured 3/2/15. Pours hazy to murky bright yellow golden with a big creamy head that just sticks around. Beautiful aroma with pineapple juice, mangoes, some light pine, floral aromatics, some citrus peel. Mmmmm. Big juicy body with pineapple and mango, light dry bitter pine, subtle sweetness that balances things perfectly. Medium low carbonation, light to medium bodied, starts juicy and finishes dry. Really nice stuff. My only complaint with a few Trilium brews Ive had is that the carbonation is on the low side. Would really like to see these get some more bubbles. But theyre good enough that they shine through that anyway.

Trilliums best beer and one of the best beers ive ever had. Aroma is an explosion od orange peel, peaches, tropical fruit, light resin.. And perfection. Taste is lightly doughy sweet with moderate crisp bitterness. Palate is full with nice soft carbonation.

5/I/15 - 75cl bottle @ home - BB: n/a, bottled: X/28/14 (2015-9) Thanks to jc1762 and his wife for sharing the bottle!
Cloudy deep yellowish beer, creamy irregular off-white head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of exotic fruits, little funky, sweet grapes, peaches, bit floral, very nice!! MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: fruity start, passion fruit, mango, little bitter, funky touch. Aftertaste: very fruity, bitter, little funky, grapes, grapefruit, mango, very very nice beer!

2 weeks old poured from a bottle into a snifter glass. Beautiful looking beer...clear, orange-yellow...nice frothy white head. Head retention and lacing is excellent. Smell is citrus bomb...mostly mango then grapefruit with some earthiness. Mildly bitter, creamy, characteristic mouthfeel of most Trillium pales. Finish is very clean, a little dry...inviting...extremely crushable beer.

Bottle shared by voodoofish65usf. Poured hazy golden color with an average frothy white head that lasted with excellent lacing. Moderate to heavy grapefruit and earthy hop aroma. Medium to full body with a slick texture with soft carbonation. Moderate to heavy bittersweet flavor with a moderate to heavy bittersweet finish of medium to long duration. Very good brew.

750 ml bottle shared voodoofish65usf. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. The aroma is wonderful, big orange citrus and tropical fruit leap form the snifter. The flavor has nice orange citrus, though not as much as the nose indicated, tropical fruits, pale malts, toasted bread, mild to moderate bitterness, this was very good and would be welcome back to a tasting.

750mL bottle thanks to Joel. Pours pale orange yellow with a off white head. Big tropical fruit hop nose... Mango, pineapple. Flavor follows,juicy mango, pineapple lead to grassy bitter in the finish. Very nice.

Bomber, thanks to voodoofish65usf for sharing. Hazy darker golden color. Thin off-white kind of bubbly head. Good dots and bits of lace. Amazing nose on this guy. Wonderful tropical citrus aromas, bit of yeastiness. Bigger bitter taste, dry finish. Medium body. Smooth, kind of crisp, lighter carbonation. Dry finish. Just how much dry-hop went into this? Huge amount of galaxy, and I love it. Very pungent, potent, assertive aroma. One of the better showcases of Galaxy Ive ever tried. Delicious.

Pours with a nice head. 

The nose shows mostly subtle tropical tones. The palate also shows a lot of the same with a very tame bitterness. The flavors are much more subtle and definitely shows itself as a derivative of the original. Regardless, Id recommend this fresh as possible and chilled for a summer day. The bottle would easily finish itself.

Slightly hazy warm golden colour, white head. Hoppy aroma, tropical fruits, pineapple, very fruity. Hoppy flavour, quite bitter, tropical fruits, light mentos. Hoppy finish, malts, hoppy funk, nice!!(from 75cL @ Tims place. Thanks for sharing, jc1762!)

Une base très verte et puissamment aromatique de houblons collants et résineux qui ne peux laisser personne indifférent Je préfère la régulière par un cheveux et cest le même profil céréalier, grandiose.
Bottle thanks to Will. Pours a cloudy orange with frothy white head that lasts. The aroma is strong tropical fruit, mango, galaxy. Medium mouthfeel with strong juicy fruit, light dryness, very nice.

Thanks to Andrew for this rarity. Lightly bronzed golden pour, opaque to a degree and retaining a thin film of white. Prickly pear and green garlic scape aroma. Stinging notes of tangelo and pineapple seeming more sharply acidic than glowing or juicy. Saltwater taffy reveals a tiny touch of butter. It is overall staunch and pungent, and on the greener side, which is enjoyable; the brilliant fruit notes of its class of peers are quieter here.

Green garlic, green banana, and sweet grass are the leading flavors; rather unusual but expressive. Strangely, even the buttery coloring here thats impossible to dismiss has a certain greenness to it. Fucking grass fed dairy. Apart from this, the kiwi, fresh grass clippings, scallion and tarragon are effusive and cooly pungent; this is one of the greenest presentations Ive ever experienced. There are pepper and mineral undertones, but little in the way of sturdy supportive malt; it is in fact hard to separate the slippery butter notes from what feels like a pinch of crystal malt.

The palate here is crisp with some pleasant mineral character and drying blonde malts. The lurking astringency of sweet tea malt consistently competes with the elegant greenery of the hops. The finish brings back this grass fed butter thing and some herb oil. Its rather hard to accurately characterize whats to like and dislike here; its surely a net positive.

Bottle shared by Al with Mark and I. Pours murky orange gold. Aroma is one of the juiciest and pineapple/guava forward I have encountered. Flavor is most of the same wit Tangerine, pineapple, mango and orange wet funk. Medium and chewy mouth. Amazing.

Pours hazy gold into a tulip. Bright white head with medium retention recedes leaving spider lacing to coat surface. Tropical fruit, farmhouse and resin aromas. Soft with grass, caramel and toffee upfront turning to passionfruit and mango before the lasting citrus pith finish.

32 oz growler tossed via courtesy of Dr. Shithead. Thanks! Its about fucken time that someone outside of the MA Homer Society got a crack at this one. Pours a milky yellow orange appearance with a white head and seemingly nice carbonation. Wow, the Galaxy hops are amazing in the nose. Big oniony, garlic, lemon/grapefruity, dry cracker aroma. Smells very inviting. Mouth feel is a bit sticky. Dry cracker, very easy drinking, super herbal/dank/oniony hoppy flavor. Im not sure I get as much citrus as some of the other ratings. I guess the hops remind me more of a dank, grapefruity flavor of Amarillo. Anyhow, super easy to drink and very clean. Im definitely a fan. Real chill courtesy offering just then via Louise. (Note: originally tasted on 12/13/13 but moving it to the correct place now on 10/26/14).
Bottle shared by Jake. Pours orange gold white head. Nose/taste of fresh tropical fruit, mango, light malt and citrus. Some pine. Medium body.

UPDATED: SEP 23, 2014 growler. this beer lifts with some big juicy tropical fruits. complex musty, soft rustic grapefruit and resin character. dry. potent hope presence. bit of tropical fruit clementine sweetness provides some balance. petes tame.

Before I rate this, I know the Galaxy Dry-Hopped will probably be aliased as the standard Fort Point Pale Ale, which I disagree with because how does hopping, which is actually part of the brewing process, not count as a different beer, but different barrel-aging (not part of the brewing process) does count as a different beer? Anyways, 32oz growler in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma strong of tropical fruits and citrusy hops and a nice balance of from the light malts. Flavor the same with an incredible, fruity, citrusy hoppiness. Average texture. Omg, Wow, Holy crap. What an insanely good beer.

bottle shared by shared by marheb-miche duo, thanks! galaxy hry hopped version. pours cloudy pale yellow greyish with a very nice creamy white cap offering good retention and lacing. bright citrus and melons, pineapple, mangoes, hint of coconut and vanilla, cushiony pale lightly honeyed malts, clean americam yeast. light carbonation, light body - oily and very silky - incredible texture, akin to some excellent vermont brews texture, balanced grassy-citrusy finish. very solid ipa.

Galaxy dryhopped edition shared by Miche & Marheb, thanks a lot people of Montreal! Pours a hazy light golden with a medium white head that offers really good lacing. Nose is almost of pure tropical fruit juice, mangoes, peaches and apricots but there is some slight perfume in the finish as well. Taste is moderately bitter, offers some light cereals, more fruity hops and some good supporting sweetness. Body was medium, carbonation moderately high. Overall a really nice pale ale, Id drink a lot of that if it were local to me!

Bottle (750 ml). Dry hopped w/ galaxy version. Shared by Marheb & Miche, thanks! Hazy pale yellow/golden with a medium white head and good lacing. Aroma is stunning with dank hops, grapefruits, pine, mineral notes, nice herbal presence, light malt... super hoppy, but also really "complex" for the style. Taste is also dominated by grapefruits and pine with a light but effective malt backbone, very light bitterness and dank hops. Alcohol is really well hidden. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Creamy/fluffy mouthfeel. Slightly oily too. Dry finish. Really tasty and super drinkable/quenching. Wonderful stuff. One of the best Pale Ale I ever had. On the same level as HF Edward. Loved it!
Growler sample from, I think, sonnycheeba, thanks! Dry hopped Galaxy version. Huge bright pine aroma. Tasty, earthy, dank taste. Love it.
Bottle dry hopped. Yellow pour with white head. Very galaxy and other hop forward aromas and flavors. Nice hop forward pale ale.

Growler @ The Bruery, transcontinental courtesy from loineshawn, PhD. This is the Galaxy dry hopped version. Hazy golden pour with a white head. Huge pineapple, grapefruit, and melon. Lots of floral notes, biscuit, and dough. Really nice flavor. Mild malt sweetness and a strong bitterness. Tons of pineapple, peach, and melon. Grapefruit, pine, and floral hop notes, too. Noms.

32oz growler, galaxy version, brokensail via loineshawn tag team. Big want, thank you sirs! Full haze, glowing straw pour. Good white foam. Nose is spot on dank mango. Taste is powerfully bitter, moving to slightly nutty and quite aggressive with full hop power. Palate is big grapefruit juice, complete hop content into the long finish. Really good.
